history.proof: intros Hcont. unfold continuous, monotone. intros M Hchain. apply Hcont.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
D2: cpo
D1: cpo
f: D1 -> D2

Goal:
continuous -> monotone f

Premises:
continuous = exists M : monotone f, forall s : chain D1, f (lim s) = lim [f^^sbyM] : Prop
Notation cpo := CPO.type
monotone : forall T1 T2 : poset, (T1 -> T2) -> Prop
dapp_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [D1 : cpo D2 : cpo f : D1 -> D2 |- Type] ?T : [D1 : cpo D2 : cpo f : D1 -> D2 |- ?A -> poset]
app_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [D1 : cpo D2 : cpo f : D1 -> D2 |- Type] ?T : [D1 : cpo D2 : cpo f : D1 -> D2 |- poset]
Sub : forall x : ?T, ?P x -> ?sT where ?T : [D1 : cpo D2 : cpo f : D1 -> D2 |- Type] ?P : [D1 : cpo D2 : cpo f : D1 -> D2 |- pred ?T] ?sT : [D1 : cpo D2 : cpo f : D1 -> D2 |- subType ?P]
prod_chain : forall (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2), monotone f1 -> monotone f2 -> chain [posetofS1 * S2] -> chain (pairPoset T1 T2)
pairCPO = fun A B : cpo => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := {| Poset.mixin := pairPosetMixin A B |}; CPO.mixin := pairCPOMixin A B |} (A * B) : cpo -> cpo -> cpo
dfunCPO : forall A : Type, (A -> cpo) -> cpo
CPO.Pack : forall sort : Type, CPO.class_of sort -> Type -> cpo
comp_mono = fun (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (x y : T3) (H : x <== y) => M1 (f2 x) (f2 y) (M2 x y H) : forall (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2), monotone f1 -> monotone f2 -> monotone (f1 \o f2) Arguments comp_mono {T1 T2 T3} {f1 f2}%function_scope
image_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain T1 -> forall f : T1 -> T2, monotone f -> chain T2
funCPO = fun (A : Type) (B : cpo) => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := {| Poset.mixin := funPosetMixin A B |}; CPO.mixin := funCPOMixin A B |} (A -> B) : Type -> cpo -> cpo Arguments funCPO _%type_scope
CPO.poset = fun cT : cpo => Poset.Pack (CPO.class cT) cT : cpo -> poset CPO.poset is a coercion
tarski_lfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_lfp f) = tarski_lfp f
tarski_gfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_gfp f) = tarski_gfp f
CPO.sort = fun t : cpo => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : cpo -> Type CPO.sort is a coercion
comp_chainE : forall (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2) (s : chain T3) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2), [f1^^[f2^^sbyM2]byM1] = [f1 \o f2^^sbycomp_mono M1 M2]
subCPO : forall (D : cpo) (s : Pred D), chain_closed s -> cpo
proj1_prodE : forall (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (s : chain [posetofS1 * S2]), proj1_chain (prod_chain M1 M2 s) = [f1^^proj1_chain sbyM1]
proj2_prodE : forall (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (s : chain [posetofS1 * S2]), proj2_chain (prod_chain M1 M2 s) = [f2^^proj2_chain sbyM2]
CPO.clone : forall (T : Type) (cT : cpo) (c : CPO.class_of T), phant_id (CPO.class cT) c -> cpo
CPO.pack : forall (T : Type) (b0 : Poset.class_of T) (m0 m : CPO.mixin_of (Poset.Pack b0 T)), phant_id m0 m -> cpo
image_chainP : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (s : chain T1) (f : T1 -> T2), monotone f -> chain_axiom [Pred x2 | exists x1 : T1, x2 = f x1 /\ x1 \In s]
latCPO = fun A : lattice => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := Lattice.class A; CPO.mixin := latCPOMixin A |} A : lattice -> cpo
CPO.lim = fun cT : cpo => [eta CPO.mx_lim (CPO.mixin (CPO.class cT))] : forall cT : cpo, chain cT -> cT Arguments CPO.lim {cT}
predCPO = fun A : Type => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := {| Poset.mixin := funPosetMixin A propCPO |}; CPO.mixin := predCPOMixin A |} (Pred A) : Type -> cpo Arguments predCPO _%type_scope
fprod : forall A1 A2 B1 B2 : Type, (A1 -> B1) -> (A2 -> B2) -> A1 * A2 -> B1 * B2
fun_leq : forall (A : Type) (B : poset), (A -> B) -> (A -> B) -> Prop
chain_closed = fun T : cpo => [Pred s | bot \In s /\ (forall d : chain T, d <=p s -> lim d \In s)] : forall T : cpo, Simpl_Pred (Pred T) Arguments chain_closed {T}
SubPredFun : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (pT2 : PredType T2), (T1 -> pT2) -> (T1 -> pT2) -> Prop
prod_mono = fun (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (__top_assumption_ : pairPoset S1 S2) => (fun _evar_0_ : forall (a : S1) (b : S2), (fun p : S1 * S2 => forall y : pairPoset S1 S2, p <== y -> (f1 \* f2) p <== (f1 \* f2) y) (a, b) => let (x, x0) as p return ((fun p0 : S1 * S2 => forall y : pairPoset S1 S2, p0 <== y -> (f1 \* f2) p0 <== (f1 \* f2) y) p) := __top_assumption_ in _evar_0_ x x0) (fun (x1 : S1) (x2 : S2) (__top_assumption...
Field_theory.mk_afield : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> ~ req rI rO -> (forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q))) -> (forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req
ssr_suff : forall Plemma Pgoal : Type, (Plemma -> Pgoal) -> Plemma -> Pgoal
PeanoNat.Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
comp = fun (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (g : C -> B) (x : C) => f (g x) : forall A B C : Type, (B -> A) -> (C -> B) -> C -> A Arguments comp {A B C}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope _ /
Inductive proof : Set := Hyp : forall e : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 e -> Ztac.proof | Add : Ztac.proof -> Ztac.proof -> Ztac.proof | Mul : Ztac.proof -> Ztac.proof -> Ztac.proof | Cst : BinNums.Z -> Ztac.proof Arguments Ztac.Hyp {e}%Z_scope Arguments Ztac.Cst _%Z_scope
Ztac.proof_sind : forall P : Ztac.proof -> SProp, (forall (e : BinNums.Z) (prf : BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 e), P (Ztac.Hyp prf)) -> (forall p1 : Ztac.proof, P p1 -> forall p2 : Ztac.proof, P p2 -> P (Ztac.Add p1 p2)) -> (forall p1 : Ztac.proof, P p1 -> forall p2 : Ztac.proof, P p2 -> P (Ztac.Mul p1 p2)) -> (forall c : BinNums.Z, P (Ztac.Cst c)) -> forall p : Ztac.proof, P p
fun_lim : forall (A : Type) (B : cpo), chain [posetofA -> B] -> [posetofA -> B]
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g
app_chain : forall (A : Type) (T : poset), chain [posetofA -> T] -> A -> chain T
fun_limM : forall (A : Type) (B : cpo) (s : chain [posetofA -> B]) (x : [posetofA -> B]), (forall y : [posetofA -> B], y \In s -> y <== x) -> fun_lim s <== x
OrderedRing.rminus_morph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x y : R, req x y -> forall x0 y0 : R, req x0 y0 -> req (rminus x x0) (rminus y y0)

```intros D1 D2 f Hcont.
unfold continuous, monotone.
intros M Hchain.
apply Hcont.
intros s.
apply f_equal.
apply Hchain.
Qed.```
